Container.Name: GluetunVPN
Container.DonateText: This app and docker were generously made by qmcgaw. If you like the project please consider making a donation toward his efforts and check out the MANY other projects he has created on GitHub.
Container.Description: Lightweight swiss-knife-like VPN client to tunnel to Cyberghost, FastestVPN, HideMyAss, IPVanish, IVPN, Mullvad, NordVPN, Privado, Private Internet Access, PrivateVPN, ProtonVPN, PureVPN, Surfshark, TorGuard, VPNUnlimited, VyprVPN and Windscribe VPN servers using Go, OpenVPN, iptables, DNS over TLS, ShadowSocks and an HTTP proxy
Container.Changes:
###3.24.0
#### Features
- IVPN - Wireguard support (#584) - TCP protocol support for OpenVPN - Custom port support for OpenVPN - Servers data update (#578) - `ISP` filter (#578) - Mullvad - `WIREGUARD_PORT` support - Surfshark - Servers data improved (#575) - `LOG_LEVEL` variable (#577) - Add IP geolocation data to HTTP control server at `/v1/publicip/ip` - `OPENVPN_TARGET_IP` overrides IP for OpenVPN only - `WIREGUARD_ADDRESSES` accepts multiple comma separated IP networks
#### Fixes
- `FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS` IP rules - Wireguard - `FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS` support - Fixed cleanup of wireguard link that was preventing restarts - Surfshark `REGION` retro-compatibility restored - `MULTIHOP_ONLY` defaults to `no` - Fix panic for certain 'no server found' errors - Clear IP data when VPN is stopped
###v3.23.0 - Support for Wireguard (IVPN, Mullvad and Windscribe) - Change ownership of OpenVPN configuration file with PUID and PGID - OpenVPN custom config process user gets removed - OpenVPN custom config with custom network interface name set properly in firewall - Sorted IP addresses for servers.json - Only allow traffic through VPN interface when needed - HTTP control server /v1/openvpn route interacts with OpenVPN settings only (not provider settings) - Image size lowered to 31MB - Using Alpine 3.14 - Wireguard support
###v3.22.0 - Allow multiple comma separated values for CYBERGHOST_GROUP - Update Cyberghost servers information - Change from SHADOWSOCKS_PORT to SHADOWSOCKS_LISTENING_ADDRESS - Windscribe: only use OpenVPN IP addresses, not Wireguard ones - Cyberghost: explicit-exit-notify used only for UDP, not TCP - Fix loop state change logic deadlock (preventing a 2nd restart for all run loops) - Use latest apk-tools to fix an Alpine vulnerability - Upgrade qdm12/ss-server to v0.3.0

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PORT
Config.Description: Internal port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PORT_TCP
Config.Description: Internal TCP port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PORT_UDP
Config.Description: Internal UDP port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_PORT
Config.Description: Container Port: 8000

Config.Name: TIMEZONE
Config.Description: Specify a timezone to use to have correct log times. i.e. Europe/London

Config.Name: VPN_TYPE
Config.Description: VPN Type. Default is OpenVPN

Config.Name: VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER
Config.Description: VPN Service Provider

Config.Name: VPN_USER
Config.Description: Container Variable: OPENVPN_USER

Config.Name: VPN_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Container Variable: OPENVPN_PASSWORD

Config.Name: VPN_SERVER_REGION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of regions. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Servers-Readme

Config.Name: VPN_SERVER_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of server hostnames. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Servers-Readme

Config.Name: VPN_SERVER_NAME
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of server names. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Servers-Readme

Config.Name: OPENVPN_VERSION
Config.Description: Set the OpenVPN version to run

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PROTOCOL
Config.Description: Container Variable: PROTOCOL

Config.Name: OPENVPN_FLAGS
Config.Description: Space delimited openvpn flags to pass to openvpn

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PORT
Config.Description: 1 to 65535. Optional Wireguard custom server endpoint port

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY
Config.Description: 32 bytes key in base64 format. Wireguard private key, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRESHARED_KEY
Config.Description: 32 bytes key in base64 format. Optional Wireguard pre-shared key.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ADDRESS
Config.Description: IP network in the format xx.xx.xx.xx/xx. Wireguard interface address, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: ENABLE_DNS
Config.Description: (Recommended: on) Activate DNS over TLS with Unbound

Config.Name: DNS_PROVIDER
Config.Description: Comma delimited list of DNS over TLS providers

Config.Name: ENABLE_SHADOWSOCKS
Config.Description: Enable the internal Shadowsocks proxy

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Password to use to connect to Shadowsocks

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_METHOD
Config.Description: Method to use for Shadowsocks

Config.Name: ENABLE_HTTPPROXY
Config.Description: Enable the internal HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_USER
Config.Description: Username to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Password to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: ADDITIONAL_FIREWALL_INPUT_PORTS
Config.Description: Comma separated list of ports to allow through the default interface. This seems needed for Kubernetes sidecars.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS
Config.Description: You first need to set your LAN CIDR in FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS. For example with FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS=192.168.1.0/24

Config.Name: PUBLICIP_FILE
Config.Description: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_ADDRESS
Config.Description: Internal port number for Shadowsocks to listen on

Config.Name: ENABLE_HTTPPROXY_STEALTH
Config.Description: Stealth mode means HTTP proxy headers are not added to your requests

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_LOG
Config.Description: Enable Shadowsocks logging

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PORT
Config.Description: Internal port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_LOG
Config.Description: Logs every tunnel requests

Config.Name: FIREWALL_DEBUG
Config.Description: Prints every firewall related command. You should use it for debugging purposes only.

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_PORT
Config.Description: Listening port for the HTTP control server

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_LOG
Config.Description: Enable logging of HTTP requests

Config.Name: config
Config.Description: Container Path: /gluetun

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: Container Variable: PUID

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Container Variable: PGID
